metadata.title: CVE-2024-27413 linux
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:  efi/capsule-loader: fix incorrect allocation size  gcc-14 notices that the allocation with sizeof(void) on 32-bit architectures is not enough for a 64-bit phys_addr_t:  drivers/firmware/efi/capsule-loader.c: In function 'efi_capsule_open': drivers/firmware/efi/capsule-loader.c:295:24: error: allocation of insufficient size '4' for type 'phys_addr_t' {aka 'long long unsigned int'} with size '8' [-Werror=alloc-size]   295 |         cap_info->phys = kzalloc(sizeof(void *), GFP_KERNEL);       |                        ^  Use the correct type instead here.
